main event: A circular object with a white or red/yellow fringe was observed for 13 minutes in Yellow Springs, Ohio on June 7, 1958.
interesting points: The object appeared to be disc-shaped and flickered.
The object moved in a circular path.
The observer was scanning the sky for a particular star when they noticed the object.
The object accelerated and made unusual maneuvers, ruling out it being a satellite.
The object was observed by multiple witnesses.
sighted object: a circular object with a white or red/yellow fringe
witnesses: at least one observer, possibly more
